jvelociter\_ - (15:56): Hi guys  
jvelociter\_ - (15:56): I have a question for CSS mavens  
jvelociter\_ - (15:56): how do you vertically align to the bottom of the available space block elements inside a div ?  
jvelociter\_ - (15:58): (lucaa sdumitriu )  
lucaa - (15:59): I'm honored, jvelociter\_, but I will leave this to sdumitriu  
gvallarelli left at 15:59 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
sdumitriu - (16:00): jvelociter\_: Depends, more details  
jvelociter\_ - (16:00): ok let me paste some code on incubator  
sdumitriu - (16:00): Sure  
jvelociter\_ - (16:09): sdumitriu: check http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/TwoTipFiltersLivetable  
jvelociter\_ - (16:10): I'm trying to have the left filter area aligned to the bottom  
jvelociter\_ - (16:10): (bottom of the emclosing .tipfilters div)  
sdumitriu - (16:12): .alldocs-topfilters ?  
jvelociter\_ - (16:13): well, to be more precise, I'm trying to have the 2 filters div (topfilters and tagcloud) always aligned to the bottom of alldocs-topfilters, whatever the height of them is  
florinciu left at 16:13 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvelociter\_ - (16:13): (or whichever filter area is "taller")  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 16:13  
sdumitriu - (16:16): OK, there are two approaches:  
sdumitriu - (16:16): 1. Use position: absolute; bottom: 0;  
sdumitriu - (16:16): This is not so good and flexible  
sdumitriu - (16:16): 2. Use display: inline-block + vertical-align;  
jvelociter\_ - (16:17): OK. I tried something like 1., but maybe on the wrong element (it moved the all div to the bottom of the doc)  
sdumitriu - (16:17): The problem is that vertical-align works for elements inside a line-block  
sdumitriu - (16:17): To have a line-block, you need to have inline elements inside it  
jvelociter\_ - (16:17): ok, 2. is a better approach ?  
sdumitriu - (16:17): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16:18): But the question is, how do you want to position the two elements?  
sdumitriu - (16:18): Side by side?  
jvelociter\_ - (16:18): so it;s inline-block on the whole container  ? (.alldocs-topfilters)  
jvelociter\_ - (16:18): yes  
sdumitriu - (16:18): As in, width: 50% is good?  
jvelociter\_ - (16:18): side by side  
jvelociter\_ - (16:18): yep  
sdumitriu - (16:18): No, inline-block on the two elements  
jvelociter\_ - (16:18): ok  
sdumitriu - (16:18): tagcloud, topfilters  
sdumitriu - (16:18): vertical-align on topfilters  
jvelociter\_ - (16:19): cool, I'm going to try that  
sdumitriu - (16:20): Ping me if you need more help with it  
gvallarelli joined #xwiki at 16:28  
jvelociter\_ - (16:45): sdumitriu: I must be missing something. I've added the inline-block + vertical align on both xwiki-livetable-topfilters-tip and xwiki-livetable-tagcloud-tip  
jvelociter\_ - (16:45): but it remains on top  
Ciprian joined #xwiki at 16:49  
sdumitriu - (17:23): It's because of the float  
sdumitriu - (17:23): remove float, change width to 49%  
sdumitriu - (17:23): And hope that vmassol won't ask why it isn't documented  
jvelociter\_ - (17:24): :)  
sdumitriu - (17:24): floated elements don't take into account the display  
jvelociter\_ - (17:24): excellent  
jvelociter\_ - (17:25): works fine  
jvelociter\_ - (17:25): I'll write /\* there's not room enough for 100% \*/ for Vincent ;)  
jvelociter\_ - (17:25): thanks  
sdumitriu - (17:25): If you want to change the order, use direction: rtl on the container  
sdumitriu - (17:26): But I guess you can just change the order in the HTML  
jvelociter\_ - (17:26): yep

gvallarelli - (18:27): why irc logs are reported here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20100327 ?  
sdumitriu - (18:45): What do you mean?  
sdumitriu - (18:46): gvallarelli: That's another role of the xwikibot. logging IRC messages on the wiki  
gvallarelli - (18:47): Well I don't know it! I find this log searching through google  
gvallarelli - (18:47): the fun thing is that also this conversation is logged  
sdumitriu - (18:48): Yes, real time logging  
factor left at 18:48 (Read error: Connection reset by peer

gvallarelli - (18:50): I think it's a privacy issue  
sdumitriu - (18:51): Yes, just noticed that, that's why I added it in the chan description  
gvallarelli - (18:52): ok np  
gvallarelli - (18:58): I want to work on Oo + XWiki integration  
gvallarelli - (18:58): if I will not be selected for GSoC  
gvallarelli - (19:02): unbelievable how many students miss the application deadline -\_-
